Superman.Action: Stands on deck in a calm manner despite an attack from behind by crooks with crowbar, does not react aggressively.
Lies down on broken railway tracks, allowing a train to pass safely over him.
Lowers his head while lying on broken tracks, showing a solemn or self-sacrificing attitude.
Recognizes tension around him but remains chipper and friendly as Clark Kent in the office.
Lies down on broken railway tracks to allow the train to pass safely over him, preventing disaster.
Uses super speed to reverse the rotation of the Earth and restore normalcy.
Greets Alice cheerily and compliments her blouse.
Persistently tries to talk to Jimmy Olsen despite Jimmy being busy on the phone.
Shows a puzzled look and asks Perry about the terrorist group, indicating sincere curiosity and engagement.
Responds cheerily and attempts small talk despite being preoccupied, showing social ease.
Attempts to get information from Jimmy Olsen but stops when confused and asks Perry for clarification, showing awareness of his limits.
Shows confusion and admits lack of awareness about urgent current events, indicating momentary lapse in situational awareness.
Turns to Perry for guidance and follows orders promptly once given, demonstrating ability to act on instructions.
Shows concern about the safety of hostages and Lois Lane involved in a dangerous situation.
Prioritizes checking on others' well-being over his own reading and comfort.
Remains absorbed in thought, indicating possible hesitation or worry but not taking immediate action.
Shows concern about the terrorist threat and the hostages, asks intelligent questions about the situation.
Is momentarily distracted reading Dickens instead of paying attention to urgent news.
Considers the safety of Lois Lane thoughtfully, indicating awareness but no immediate action shown in excerpt.
Follows advice promptly and decisively by taking off quickly when told to act.
Transforms efficiently and skillfully from Clark Kent to Superman using time-lapse effect, showing control and mastery of his abilities.
No direct action or statement by Superman present in the excerpt; implicitly no intervention during hostage situation.
No direct action or intervention shown in this excerpt despite a crisis situation with Lois hanging under the elevator and a bomb set to explode.
Rescues Lois from a falling elevator, calming her with light humor despite the danger.
Immediately acts to push the elevator to safety at super-speed upon learning about the bomb threat.
Hurls the elevator with the bomb into outer space to protect Earth.
Darts into moving traffic trying to catch up with Lois and gets hit by a taxi.
Immediately reassures Lois that he is okay and promptly gets up and dusts himself off, showing physical resilience and calm.
Does not heed basic safety advice (looking both ways before crossing), showing lack of caution despite his abilities.
Responds to Lois's earnest advice with good-natured teasing about X-ray vision and glasses.
Shows curiosity and mild amusement towards Lois's effort to make fresh orange juice despite the difficulty.
Acknowledges Lois's advice about looking both ways and jokes about not having X-ray vision.
Touches his glasses nervously, showing slight insecurity or self-consciousness.
Shows curiosity and engages with Lois's health routine, asking what she is doing.
Clumsily makes a mess with orange juice but remains unperturbed and lighthearted.
Responds to Lois' blunt criticism by expressing hurt but does not retaliate or react negatively.
Tries to use the juicer despite initial clumsiness and juice spilling on his clothes; remains unperturbed and determined to get the hang of it.
Hesitates when Lois offers constructive criticism about being more aggressive and trusting his instincts.
Offers a tentative suggestion to try the juicer after Lois struggles, showing willingness to engage and learn.
Stops a massive threat and prevents millions of deaths, demonstrating effectiveness and skill.
Invisible to radar and moves so fast opponents cannot trace him, showing high capability and mastery.
Expresses dashed hope and sadness during the interaction with Lois, revealing some vulnerability but not incompetence.
Able to evade all radar tracking and flies off before detection.
Does not have an identified vulnerability for Lex to exploit yet.
No direct action or statement from Superman in the excerpt; presence only implied through Lex and Otis' conversation.
No direct action or response in this excerpt; does not intervene or demonstrate skill in the situations shown.
Responds stiffly and awkwardly to the bellboy's flirtatious remarks, maintains politeness but shows discomfort.
Acknowledges the romantic setting with a sincere comment, shows appreciation for romance despite awkwardness.
Hands the bellboy a tip politely after his somewhat awkward pitch.
Compliments Lois sincerely, misunderstanding her sarcastic remark.
Earnestly supports Lois's mission to expose the honeymoon racket, showing sincere concern.
Politely tips the bellboy to end the awkward sales pitch situation efficiently.
Misunderstands Lois's sarcastic comment about 'magic fingers,' taking it literally and responding sincerely.
Earnestly insists on exposing the honeymoon racket, showing commitment to the mission despite Lois’s cynicism.
Shyly unwraps an orchid and puts it on Lois, showing a gentle, considerate gesture.
Observes surroundings with appreciation and lightheartedness (complimentary champagne, corsage), engaging warmly with the moment.
Expresses awkwardness about sleeping arrangements, showing sincerity and openness.
Shows awareness of social niceties by unwrapping orchid and shyly placing it on Lois, indicating social competence and emotional intelligence.
Blurts out awkwardly about sleeping arrangements, showing a lack of smooth social confidence in a personal situation.
Observes surroundings attentively and notes details like complimentary champagne and corsage, showing situational awareness.
Shows vulnerability and slight discomfort when Lois cleans his glasses and looks at him without them, indicating trust and openness.
Maintains a gentle, wistful attitude while observing happy couples, showing tenderness and sensitivity.
Relaxes and is relieved when distracted by the child’s sudden interruption, showing comfort in informal social moments.
Uses X-Ray vision but fails to notice his glasses are completely misted up, impairing his ability to see clearly.
Calmly retrieves and replaces his glasses after being unexpectedly scrutinized, showing composure.
Allows Lois to clean his glasses and receives help without complaint, showing a willingness to accept assistance.
Smiles warmly at Lois, calls her amazing, and offers to get hot dogs and freshly squeezed orange juice for her.
Quickly pulls Jason to safety when he nearly falls, showing concern and protective instincts.
Does not react negatively when the mother mistakenly treats him as a stranger with ill intent after saving her child.
Quickly intervenes to save the child Jason from danger by pulling him to safety just in time.
Does not assert himself or correct the misunderstanding when Jason's mother accuses him of molestation, allowing the situation to escalate unaddressed.
Patiently waits in a long line at the hot dog stand without complaining, showing self-control and humility.
Rescues Jason from falling over Niagara Falls, saving him at the last moment.
Jokes gently with Jason about only giving one ride to a customer, engaging warmly with the child.
Leaves quickly after the rescue despite Lois trying to get his attention, resulting in Lois feeling dejected.
Swoops down at high speed and catches Jason just before he hits the rapids, saving his life.
Calmly returns Jason safely to the ground and lightheartedly interacts with him, displaying confidence and control.
Quickly departs after the rescue without clearly acknowledging Lois who is trying to get his attention.
Leaves a dollar behind for hot dogs after picking them up, showing honesty and consideration.
Attempts to deflect Lois's questioning with light humor and defensiveness.
Lands discreetly behind the hot dog stand, appears as Clark Kent, and makes an honest gesture by leaving a dollar for hot dogs before walking away.
Attempts to deflect Lois's suspicions about his whereabouts when Superman appears, but slips by not maintaining full composure.
Tries to evade Lois' probing questions and appears nervous; attempts to deflect and walks away to avoid confrontation.
Follows Lois anxiously when she confronts him on the bridge, showing concern despite trying to avoid the topic.
Attempts to deflect Lois's suspicions with nervousness and faked ignorance but ultimately faces her head-on without running away.
Shows some anxiety and discomfort under interrogation, suggesting some difficulty maintaining his secret identity convincingly.
Responds with concern and takes quick action to save Lois when she jumps into the river.
Laughs off Lois's risky bet about his identity initially.
Quickly recognizes the danger Lois is in and formulates a plan using Heat-Vision to break the branch for rescue.
Initially reluctant and dismissive about the bet and Lois's life risk; hesitates before acting.
Appears momentarily uncertain and internally conflicted, shown by 'Now what do I do?'
Warns Lois to grab the branch and helps pull her to safety with genuine effort.
Makes a playful show of struggling in the water to lighten the moment despite danger.
Smiles sheepishly after being rescued, showing humility and sincerity.
Uses Heat-Vision to burn through the branch precisely to free Lois.
Uses Super-Breath to safely propel the branch and Lois across the river to the bank.
Runs to help pull Lois to safety and grabs the branch to hoist her up.
Loses his footing and falls into the river himself, then pretends he cannot swim.
Eventually manages to grab hold of the branch Lois extends to him and gets hauled up.
No direct action taken or shown; the scene focuses on Zod, Ursa, and Non without Superman's involvement or intervention.
Leans on the mantelpiece looking at Lois adoringly, appearing calm and collected in a relaxed, domestic setting.
Uses X-ray vision discreetly without mentioning it, allowing Lois to feel comfortable and unembarrassed.
Falls into the fire while focused on Lois, unintentionally causing concern; allows Lois to tend to him and does not react harshly.
Uses X-ray vision to find Lois's lost comb in the drawer without making a fuss.
Trips over an unexpected obstacle (bear head rug) and falls, plunging his hand into the fire.
Quickly pulls his hand out of the fire unharmed, demonstrating resilience and control.
Turns away in anguish and frustration when Lois recognizes him, showing vulnerability.
Responds seriously and upset to Lois but reassures her she has nothing to be sorry about.
Decides to be open and honest with Lois about everything now that she knows his secret.
Invites Lois to talk privately at his place, showing trust and intimacy.
Turns away in anguish and frustration, unable to finish his sentence about being Superman.
Acknowledges emotional difficulty honestly and decides to have a serious private conversation with Lois, showing thoughtful handling of a delicate situation.
Makes a tough decision to reveal his full identity and truth to Lois in a controlled setting.

Flies confidently through the sky with Lois in his arms.

Leads Lois inside the Fortress of Solitude, showing openness and a desire to share his home.
Struggles earnestly to master his Heat-Vision, showing persistence and a childlike effort.
Attempts to use Heat-Vision by concentrating and imitating Zod, eventually producing a weak and pitiful beam, indicating initial struggle but persistence.
No direct action, statement, or involvement shown in this excerpt; notably absent from the conflict and interactions.
Is present in the Fortress of Solitude explaining the Green Crystal to Lois, handling it with reverence and knowledge.
Shows Lois the Fortress with shy pride and expresses hope she will like it.
Admits embarrassment about not handling dinner well, then offers to make it special for Lois.
Selects elegant tropical flowers carefully, demonstrating attention to detail and thoughtfulness.
Explains the Green Crystal and its significance with reverence and clarity, showing deep understanding and meaningful connection.
Handles the Green Crystal carefully and respectfully, indicating skill and knowledge.
Admits he is not good with dinner preparations and shows slight embarrassment.
Quickly promises Lois anything she wants for dinner, showing willingness but possibly a lack of follow-through or practical planning.
Effortlessly locates and chooses elegant tropical flowers with apparent ease and speed.
Intercepts the champagne bottle mid-launch to keep the ceremony on track, then offers to pay for the next round.
Approaches a grocer to buy eggs politely and respectfully.
Intercepts the champagne bottle mid-launch to prevent it from breaking, enabling the ship to be launched successfully despite the missing bottle.
Calls out humorously 'The next round's on me!' after the champagne mishap, showing confidence and lightheartedness.
Rights the Leaning Tower of Pisa to an erect position, unknowingly ruining the shopkeeper's business.
Flies at tremendous speed to the Leaning Tower of Pisa and uses his power to right the Tower into an erect position, fixing a major structural flaw.
Flies lovestruck through the sky, carrying wine and flowers, which shows a distracted or casual attitude despite having great power and speed.

Unintentionally causes damage to the cornerstone of the Leaning Tower by flying at high speed around it, which leads to the Tower being righted but at the cost of structural integrity and causing distress to the shopkeeper.
Greets Lois warmly with 'Hi, Lois! I'm home!' showing a friendly, affectionate tone.
Returns home cheerfully and confidently, greeting Lois warmly.
Allows Lois to carelessly place the Green Crystal down where it rolls out of sight and is forgotten.
Not present or active in the scene, no intervention or response to the villains' broadcast and threats.
Uses Heat-Vision skillfully to disable the jeep by targeting its tires accurately, causing it to crash and stop the enemy advance.
Pauses to allow Non to try Heat-Vision instead of taking immediate action himself.
Uses heat vision skillfully to perfectly raise a soufflé, demonstrating precision and control.

Does not respond to destruction or crisis promptly (as questioned by aides about his absence), potentially indicating delay or omission.
Smiles and honestly expresses liking being Clark Kent.
Sits troubled near the Crystal Bank, acknowledging his need for Lois sincerely.
Expresses his love for Lois openly and sincerely, stating she's all he wants in life.
Sits thoughtfully near the Memory Crystal Bank, seeking answers from the image of his mother, indicating careful consideration and emotional intelligence.
Admits honestly that he likes being Clark Kent sometimes, showing self-awareness but no direct demonstration of competence.
Expresses need firmly and clearly ('I have to ask...she's all I want in life'), showing decisiveness and emotional clarity.
Engages in a private emotional moment rather than taking immediate action on pressing matters, indicating temporary pause but not incompetence.
Expresses desire to have a personal chance at happiness despite his responsibilities.
Acknowledges love for another and admits vulnerability in conversation with Lara.
Appears torn between duty to humanity and personal emotion, showing sincerity and internal conflict.
Considers the loss of his powers to live as a mortal in order to be with Lois, expresses sincere love to his mother before entering the chamber.
Passes his hand across crystals to activate molecular restructuring mechanisms and waits with closed eyes.
Gives up his Superman powers and invulnerability for the sake of his love for Lois Lane, showing vulnerability and prioritizing personal connection over power.
Silently holds Lois close and shares a tender, intimate moment with her, showing affection and trust.
Endures the dangerous process of molecular restructuring, resulting in the separation of his Superman self and mortal Clark Kent self, showing resilience and willingness to sacrifice powers for love.
Remains completely still and insubstantial as the Superman figure fades, indicating passivity and lack of agency during a critical transformation.
Lies quietly in a tender moment with Lois, troubled internally but allowing vulnerability.
Shows internal conflict and sacrifice in personal relationship, indicating sincerity and tolerance of personal loss.
Appears troubled and reflective in the morning after sharing a peaceful moment with Lois, showing awareness of his sacrifices but not taking immediate action.

Refuses to back down from the trucker despite potential physical danger.

Engages in a potential physical fight with a much bigger adversary without seeking a safer resolution or calling for backup.

Engages in a fight despite being outmatched, showing determination but also risking harm to himself.
Does not retaliate beyond necessary and shows signs of physical and emotional restraint.
Tries to physically fight the trucker despite being outmatched and eventually collapses, showing persistence but poor tactical judgment.
Acknowledges his own vulnerability with a bitter, self-aware comment about needing a bodyguard, showing some self-reflection.
Sits silently with Lois, visibly stunned and in disbelief upon hearing the President abdicate to General Zod and the challenge issued to him.
Sits watching the President's abdication and General Zod's broadcast frozen in disbelief, stunned by events.
Looks at Lois desperately, conflicted and determined to try to help despite difficulties.
Shuts his eyes, deeply troubled and feels guilt for not listening earlier.
Doggedly treks across frozen landscape despite physical pain and bleak conditions.
Expresses deep self-blame and shame for failing others and himself, showing vulnerability and sincerity.
Cries out for help from his parents and anyone around, demonstrating openness and a desire for connection.
Accepts his fate with bowed head after feeling abandoned, indicating honesty with himself and emotional transparency.
Admits failure openly, acknowledges his mistakes and perceived shortcomings.
Experiences profound despair and gives up hope temporarily, feeling abandoned and defeated.
Despite exhaustion and despair, remains upright and eventually responds to the green light, showing openness to renewed power and direction.
Sinks on his knees and tentatively reaches for the Green Crystal, then holds it as if it were a lifeline and allows its power to flow through him, despite trembling.
Referred to as having powers similar to his adversaries, implying skill and capability.
Is the focus of a vendetta by powerful enemies planning revenge and capture, which could imply he is a significant threat due to his competence.
Makes himself scarce during a crisis, causing worry among friends and colleagues.
Leaves Lois and Jimmy without explanation, creating uncertainty about his whereabouts and intentions.
His absence causes concern among trusted allies, showing lack of clear communication or planning.
Is assumed by others (Jimmy) to have a secret plan despite no evidence yet presented.

Challenges villains openly and taunts General on the importance of Freedom of the Press, displaying confidence and a protective stance towards press freedom.
Stands in a relaxed pose on a flagpole outside Perry White's office, showing calm and presence amid chaos.
Flies swiftly and confidently to the Daily Planet building at night and lands skillfully on a flagpole outside Perry White's office.
Challenges the three villains to a fight and confronts them head-on, demonstrating confidence and readiness.

Stands waiting on a high ledge for the villains to attack him, calmly preparing for confrontation despite being outnumbered.
Refuses to bow to General Zod, stating he can't bow to someone so far beneath him.
Pulverizes the concrete slab aimed at him to protect himself and others.
Refuses to kneel or bow to Zod, confidently asserting moral and personal superiority.
Uses heat-vision to destroy the concrete slab thrown at him with precision and control.
Handles Zod's insults calmly and does not lose composure, showing emotional control.
Fails to avoid escalating the confrontation, potentially provoking a more violent response.
Whips his foot up and kicks Non powerfully, protecting the crowd.
Hesitates to punch Ursa after breaking free from her hair-pulling attack.
Expresses surprise and acknowledges difficulty of the fight.
Hesitates to hit a woman despite provocation.
Responds swiftly to save people from falling debris, catching the antenna before it hits the street.
Catches the antenna just in time to protect a woman and her baby carriage, allowing them to run to safety.
Flies down at super-speed to stop Zod from setting fire to cars and a tanker truck, preventing massive destruction and danger to people.
Catches the antenna just in time, saving a woman and child.
Pins Non down by flying up and putting the cage-like antenna over him.
Sees Zod setting fire to cars and the tanker truck and reacts immediately by zooming down at super-speed.
Uses the rear-view mirror to reflect Zod's Heat-Vision beams, acting quickly and creatively.
Grabs Zod by hand and foot and flings him away after being knocked down.
Recovers quickly after being hit by the manhole cover, revives suddenly and confidently flings Zod away with great strength.
Initially gets caught off guard and knocked down by Ursa's attack, seeming unconscious.
Sees passengers dangling from the bus and pleads, 'No! Don't do it! The people!'
Flies down to stop more harm from being done to the passengers.
Pleadingly asks villains to stop blowing the hurricane-force wind to protect people.
Struggles to rescue people despite overwhelming force, repeatedly trying to save them from destruction.
Flies away abruptly instead of directly confronting the villains or continuing to try rescuing people.
Struggles to free himself after being pinned by a bus and attempts to help the trapped passengers.
Faces a hurricane-force Super-Breath wind and tries to stop it by pleading with the villains.
Stops to right a car but fails as it is blown past him again.
Stands immovable in the path of the devastating wind, showing determination and struggle.
Suddenly abandons the fight by turning mid-flight and fleeing into the night.
Leaves the people in a moment of crisis, causing anger and disappointment.
Flees from the villains, causing public disappointment and disbelief.
Despite fleeing, maintains the possibility of return and confrontation as implied by Lois's confident statement.
Passes his hand deliberately across crystals in the Fortress of Solitude, preparing for molecular restructuring.
Passes his hand very deliberately across various crystals in a specific sequence in the molecular restructuring chamber, mirroring previous skilled behavior.
Appears above foes calmly and demands better manners from his guests.
Deliberately goads enemies, provoking them with taunts.
Grabs and negates the combined heat-vision attack from three villains, showing calm control and deflecting aggression without escalating violence.
Remains guarded and highly alert, showing no signs of malice or aggression but focused on defense and protecting himself.
Shows confusion when villains use trickery (disappearing and relocating rapidly) but does not respond with anger or hostility.
Smiles as one of his images vanishes after disorienting enemies.
Uses multiple images to taunt General Zod, showing confidence and a playful attitude.
No direct interaction or comforting action towards Lois when she is confused and surprised.
Seizes Zod firmly when he attempts to deceive him, demonstrating protectiveness and assertiveness.
Reluctantly releases Zod to protect Lois and others, showing a willingness to sacrifice personal advantage for the safety of others.
Commands Zod to stop hurting Lois and eventually gives up to save her from harm, revealing concern and prioritizing others' wellbeing over his own pride.
Does not aggressively counterattack or escalate conflict when Lois is threatened, instead yielding, indicating patience and tolerance.
Seizes Zod in a powerful grip and warns him confidently.
Reluctantly releases Zod when Lois is threatened and is unable to prevent Zod and his cohorts from gaining the upper hand.
Gives up and admits defeat to Zod under pressure.
Says 'Perhaps there is some good in you after all, Lex Luthor.' to his enemy, showing an attempt to acknowledge good despite evil.
Plans to trap enemies and depower them to save others, showing responsibility and a protective nature.
Calls Lex Luthor 'poisonous snake' after being warned of a trap, showing distrust but no overt cruelty.
Considers using Lex Luthor's plan to trap Zod and others in the molecule chamber to depower them, showing strategic thinking.
Shows careful observation of Luthor and Zod's behavior, indicating awareness and cautiousness.
Puts some trust in Lex Luthor despite his deceptive nature, reflecting a calculated risk rather than blind trust.
Does not immediately dismiss or ignore clear warning signs (like Luthor’s warning about the trap), showing some level of prudence.
Struggles and pleads not to be captured or harmed.
Despite defeat and humiliation, silently accepts his fate without lashing out.
Struggles and kicks vainly when seized, unable to break free.
Is caught and thrown into the molecule chamber without resisting effectively.
Writhes in agony while being demolecularized, showing physical weakness.
Slowly, painfully gets back to his feet after being demolecularized but with shoulders stooped and resigned, indicating loss of confidence and capability.
Ultimately kneels to Zod, acknowledging defeat and unable to assert himself.
Feigns loyalty to Zod by taking his hand but then crushes it and throws him away, protecting others from Zod's control.
Advances on Luthor with accusatory but justified remarks, exposing his betrayal.
Does not hesitate to use physical force against enemies (throws Non, lets Lois deal with Ursa) but avoids unnecessary personal cruelty.
Takes Zod's hand in apparent submission but then uses it to crush Zod's bones and physically dominate him.
Throws Non into the wall effortlessly and progresses strategically against enemies.
Recognizes Luthor's betrayal and uses the situation to his advantage, staying confident in control.
Approaches Lois with nervousness and concern, showing love and compassion for her troubles.
Clark comes to work despite feeling nervous and unsure of himself, showing willingness to face difficulties.
Shows love and compassion toward Lois, attempts to understand her dilemma and support her emotionally.
Appears tentative and uncertain in social interaction, possibly lacking confidence.
Comforts Lois by reassuring her she's not selfish and expressing his care by saying he likes worrying about her.
Engages sincerely and empathetically in a vulnerable, emotional conversation with Lois.
Responds calmly and supportively to Lois's emotional concerns, demonstrating emotional intelligence and steady confidence.
Acknowledges the demands of others needing his help and accepts his role responsibly without defensiveness.
Does not provide a practical solution to Lois's anxiety about their relationship, focusing instead on emotional reassurance.
Takes Lois's face in his hand and pulls her toward him for a profound, lyrical, passionate kiss.
Softly whispers 'I don't know what to say' showing vulnerability and sincerity.
Reassures Jimmy that Lois will be fine when she acts dizzy.
Takes initiative to express deep feelings honestly and confidently by pulling Lois into a profound, passionate kiss.
Shows some hesitation verbally ('I don't know what to say...') indicating momentary uncertainty or emotional vulnerability.
Reassures others calmly when Lois acts dizzy ('She'll be fine.'), demonstrating composure and control in potentially worrying moments.
Smiles warmly at Lois, happy to see her feeling good despite his own pain.
Plays along with Lois' lighthearted request for a cheeseburger, engaging sincerely and in good humor.
Clark (Superman) interacts warmly and confidently with Lois, showing emotional intelligence and self-awareness despite personal pain.
Clark refrains from dominating conversation or asserting himself aggressively, indicating restraint and social skill.
Does not directly engage in an overtly heroic or skilful action in the excerpt; rather, he plays a supportive, everyday role.
Takes the TRUCKER's aggressive punch without retaliation and playfully spins his stool, causing the TRUCKER to crash but ends with a nice smile and a friendly comment.
Flies carrying an American flag to replace the broken dome of the White House, symbolizing a positive, patriotic, and protective demeanor.
Soars away from F.G. heading for the horizon, magnificent in his power, faster than a speeding bullet.
Described as more powerful than a locomotive and able to leap tall buildings in a single bound.

Clark Kent.Action: Emerges from transformation as a more mature, manly version of himself and comforts Lois Lane, demonstrating emotional intelligence and confident acceptance of his new state.
